channel.title: Prepare for survival
channel.description:
A radio sounding board for facts and opinions on civil defense.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Blast shelter policies
item.description: This program focuses on the differences between fallout shelters and blast shelters.
item.dc:creator: Murdoch, Alan
item.dc:subject: Civil defense.

item.title: National defense
item.description: This program assesses different strategies for preserving national defense.
item.dc:creator: Murdoch, Alan
item.dc:subject: Civil defense.

item.title: Who will survive World War Three?
item.description: This program, the first in the series, introduces concepts of civil defense and what Americans think about it.
item.dc:creator: Murdoch, Alan
item.dc:subject: Civil defense.

item.title: Evacuation policies
item.description: This program focuses on the controversial civil defense evacuation policies.
item.dc:creator: Murdoch, Alan
item.dc:subject: Civil defense.

item.title: Local civil defense plans and policies
item.description: This program focuses on civil defense progress in five major American cities.
item.dc:creator: Murdoch, Alan
item.dc:subject: Civil defense.

item.title: Fallout shelter policies
item.description: This program focuses on civil defense fallout shelter policies.
item.dc:creator: Murdoch, Alan
item.dc:subject: Civil defense.

item.title: Who needs civil defense?
item.description: This program anayzes the need for civil defense preparedness and features interviews with several people involved in the process.
item.dc:creator: Murdoch, Alan
item.dc:subject: Civil defense.

item.title: Preventing World War Three
item.description: This program asserts that the prevention of World War Three is the ultimate form of civil defense.
item.dc:creator: Murdoch, Alan
item.dc:subject: Civil defense.

item.title: Whose responsibility is civil defense?
item.description: This program looks at the debate over whether civil defense should be handled by the federal government, local government, or both.
item.dc:creator: Murdoch, Alan
item.dc:subject: Civil defense.

item.title: Hydrogen bomb and its effects
item.description: This program focuses on the hydrogen bomb and how civil defense experts plan for it.
item.dc:creator: Murdoch, Alan
item.dc:subject: Civil defense.

item.title: Civil defense today
item.description: This program assesses the then-current state of civil defense in the United States.
item.dc:creator: Murdoch, Alan
item.dc:subject: Civil defense.

item.title: Is civil defense futile?
item.description: This program focuses on whether or not civil defense planning is worth the time and expense.
item.dc:creator: Murdoch, Alan
item.dc:subject: Civil defense.

item.title: Where do we go from here?
item.description: This program focuses on what civil defense strategies might be taken in the future.
item.dc:creator: Murdoch, Alan
item.dc:subject: Civil defense.
